intro: Trigastrotheca, commonly known as the star-shaped leaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive leaves that are often arranged in a star-like pattern, giving it its common name. The plant typically has hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture. Trigastrotheca species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and are often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a showy display during the growing season.
